content: concentric poncho created by lisa overby 1 ball of hikoo concentric is all it takes to knit this simple poncho a 4 by 4 rib and one seam turns a rectangle into an easy to wear piece that shows off this gradient yarn beautifully ©2021 yarn twisters 1 concentric poncho materials & info abbreviations yarn 1 ball hikoo concentric 437 yards/200 g 100% bobble - bind off baby alpaca sample knit in berry good #1031 co - cast on gauge 24 sts by 24 row equal 4 by 4 in 4 by 4 rib k - knit after blocking p - purl needles 5 mm us 8 needles or size needed to ob- tain gauge st/sts - stitch/stitches notions darning needle finished size length 36 91 5 cm width 21 53 cm pattern instructions co 100 sts row 1 *k4 p4* repeat to last 4 sts k4 row 2 *p4 k4* repeat to last 4 sts p4 repeat row 1 and 2 until you are almost out of yarn ensure you have enough to bobble and seam finishing bobble all sts loosely in pattern weave in ends and block to measurements hold in half short sides together starting at one of the corners seam approx 7 18 cm on one of the long sides leaving room for your head to go through ©2021 yarn twisters 2 concentric poncho
